title: News: Grandaddy reform for End of the Road Festival
body:
Seems like their song ‘We Live Again’ predicted the future.

Psychadelic indie rockers Grandaddy have announced they will be reforming. The band are set to play a limited run of gigs this year, including taking the headline slot at this year’s [End of the Road festival](http://www.endoftheroadfestival.com/news/grandaddy-to-headline-sunday-plus-alabama-shakes-and-more/).

Jon Pareles of [The New York Times](http://www.nytimes.com/2003/10/08/business/worldbusiness/08gran.html?ex=1066276800&amp%3Ben=256b12123e350608&amp%3Bei=5062&amp%3Bpartner=) described the band’s songs in such a perfect way & it’s Friday so I’m just going to copy & paste; “Stately anthems orchestrated with full late-psychedelic pomp: fuzz-toned guitar strumming, rippling keyboards brawny drumbeats” BOOM YEAH now that’s a reccomendation if ever I read one.

The festival Grandaddy are set to play, [End of the Road](http://www.endoftheroadfestival.com/), is an intimate independent festival taking place at the Larmer Tree Gardens in North Dorset. Joining Grandaddy in the lineup include Jeffrey Lewis, Grizzly Bear & Islet.
